supporting_text: The NAP emphasizes a One Health approach to successfully contain AMR in Tuvalu.
The NAP includes specific actions in the human health sector, such as improving awareness and infection prevention and control measures.
The NAP outlines actions related to animal health, including the establishment of laboratory capacity and infection prevention measures.
The NAP includes strategies related to waste management and water sanitation as part of the environmental health focus.
The NAP addresses agricultural practices and the rational use of antimicrobials in the fisheries sector.
The NAP includes provisions for regular monitoring and evaluation of the action plan's implementation.
The NAP outlines specific targets to be achieved within the 2021-2025 timeframe.
The NAP includes targets related to antimicrobial consumption monitoring and AMR surveillance.
The NAP mentions the need for a dedicated budget for AMR activities.
The NAP includes a Costing and M&E Framework to assist in submitting for annual budgetary requirements.
The NAP establishes the National Drugs and Therapeutics Committee (NDTC) to coordinate AMR activities.
The NAP includes actions to review and strengthen existing legislation related to antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes plans to revise educational curricula to incorporate AMR awareness.
The NAP outlines plans for public awareness campaigns and community engagement on AMR.
The NAP mentions collaboration with WHO and other international organizations for technical support.
The NAP includes actions to establish functioning microbiology laboratory capacity and strengthen surveillance systems.
The NAP emphasizes the need for capacity building in AMR detection and reporting.
The NAP includes strategies for infection prevention and control measures and sanitation practices.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes actions to maintain and update the Essential Medicines List for antibiotics.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to promote the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes plans to strengthen research and innovation related to AMR.
